The venture is a reminder that Google's ambitions stretch well beyond the internet. Eric Schmidt says: We're trying to make all the world's information accessible. People make the mistake of thinking that's just web information. International summits such as the World Economic Forum are clearly ripe for language interpretation, so could we soon be listening to digitised translations by Google? He described the scene, saying, People came from all around, surrounding us, punching us, kicking us, trying to rip the clothes off my female producer. It was weird. And we were lucky, frankly.... I would start to slap back and then realize this is going to make it worse. My adrenline was pumping so much. I've never really been in a fight like this or attacked by a mob like this. I thought I was saying calm down, as if they could understand what I was saying.
